metadata.title: Six Human Heads Found on a Highway in Central Mexico

left: Authorities found six severed heads along a road in central Mexico, where such violence is rare, according to prosecutors.
Local media reported a pamphlet blaming the violence on gang disputes over fuel theft.
The Tlaxcala Prosecutor's Office confirmed the heads belonged to men and has started an investigation.
This discovery occurs during a crackdown on fentanyl trafficking by President Claudia Sheinbaum's administration.
